items.title: World shares slip and gold sets a fresh record high of over $3,550 per ounce
items.description: The price of gold has hit a new record and world shares are mostly lower after U.S. markets were closed for the Labor Day holiday

items.title: Top Japanese beverage giant Suntory's chief resigns as he faces a drug probe
items.description: Takeshi Niinami, a Japanese business leader and CEO of beverage giant Suntory, has resigned as he is facing an investigation into his alleged possessi...

items.title: Nonprofits face a tough funding landscape. They hope better storytelling will bring more donations
items.description: Nonprofits are increasingly using storytelling to connect with donors

items.title: Yemenis mourn killed Houthi prime minister as rebel group targets ship in Red Sea
items.description: Hundreds of Yemenis have mourned the death of Houthi Prime Minister Ahmed al-Rahawi, killed last week in an Israeli strike

items.title: Former Columbia University president Minouche Shafik tapped as UK economic adviser
items.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has appointed economist Minouche Shafik as his chief economic adviser
